profileAlternative.name: Christopher Biscardi
profileAlternative.headline: Independent Consultant for Startups
profileAlternative.summary:
I am an entrepreneurial minded full stack engineer with expertise in JavaScript (React, GraphQL, CSS-in-JS, babel, node, etc), Golang, Kubernetes, Docker, and Haskell, including having written a book on Haskell web development. My talks can be viewed at conferences such as QCon, GopherCon, React Amsterdam, and ForwardJS as well as various meetups.

I consult in two main areas:

* Building teams around specific initiatives (such as building a Design System team).
* Applying modern and emerging technologies (GraphQL, CSS-in-JS, K8s/Containerization, JAMStack/GatsbyJS, React) using mainly Golang and JavaScript.

given.text:
I had the pleasure of hiring and managing Chris while working at Docker. Before we hired Chris we didn't really have a front end developer, and what we had was a mess. Chris was able to come in and help us completely change what we had so that it was a more modern stack, and it is still the basis for what is getting used today. He helped me hire other front end developers to build out our front end team, and lead in the creation of a common frontend toolset and framework which is still used today. Since I wasn't a front end developer, and I didn't stay up to date on all the day to day advances, I was able to count on Chris to keep me informed on what was going on, and to make sure we were not doing something wrong. I really liked working with Chris, and I hope I get a chance to work with him again in the future.
